message.content:
It's important to register a copyright for any creative work that you want to protect and claim exclusive rights to, such as books, paintings, photographs, music compositions or performances. Registering your work officially establishes it as yours and provides legal protection from plagiarism or unauthorized use.

Here are the main steps in registering a copyright:

1. Determine whether your work is eligible for copyright protection.
Before registering a copyright, be sure that your work falls within the scope of materials protected under intellectual property law like literature works (books, poems), visual arts (paintings, drawings), photography etc.

2. Create an account on the U.S. Copyright Office website.
Go to www.copyright.gov and click on "Register" in the top navigation menu if you're in the United States (other countries have their own government bodies). Follow instructions provided by website for creating an account.

3. Complete application form online.
After logging into your account created with U.S._Copyright_Office_eco system_make_sure_you_have_attached_digital_versions_of_your_works_to_be_registered alongside_right_info_about_authorship_and_publication_history

4. Pay registration fee & submit application form
